intro: Espeletia killipii, commonly known as the Killip's espeletia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette growth pattern and dense, woolly foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in cloud forests and páramo ecosystems. Due to its unique adaptations, it plays an important role in the biodiversity of its native habitat.
